headline: Easy Oatmeal Muffins
description: These oatmeal muffins are made with basic pantry staples like heart-healthy oats, milk, and egg for an on-the-go breakfast or a quick mid-day snack.
name: Easy Oatmeal Muffins

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Grease 12 standard muffin cups or line with paper muffin liners.
Combine milk and oats in a small bowl; let soak for 15 minutes.

Beat together egg and oil in a large bowl; stir in oat mixture. Sift together flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a separate bowl. Stir flour mixture into wet ingredients until just combined. Spoon batter into the prepared muffin cups until 2/3 full.
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean, 20 to 25 minutes.

review.reviewBody: The idea behind this recipe is good, but the actual muffins didn’t come out good. The oats are super hard. Maybe next time I’ll use instant oatmeal.

Turned out quite nice. Very easy to make which was great I just made it harder by not having some of the ingredients at hand. I used brown sugar instead of white and added blueberries and they taste a bit floury still. They taste healthy and like breakfast muffins and not too sweet which I really like.

I made Oatmeal Raisin muffins. I found these perfectly sweetened and low sugar just what I was looking for. I used spelt flour instead and brown sugar in place of the white sugar. I used grapeseed oil. I added 1/4 cup raisins rinsed in hot water. I also added each 1 teaspoon each of cinnamon and vanilla. I used oat milk. I baked for 20 minutes at 400F in parchment paper muffin cups. The muffins are quite delicate when warm and a bit dry. I'd add 1/3 cup of oil next time. I'll try making these again with the extra oil and a higher fat milk. I will also try making these into 9 jumbo muffins.
Delicious, with just a hint of sweetness. I added dried cranberries and walnuts.

I made this recipe a couple of times and it’s a really good base - a simple breakfast or lunch muffin, not sweet like storebought muffins. The second time I forgot to soak the oats and mixed them in with flour first- still turned out good, maybe a tad drier. I also used half buttermilk and some chocolate chips. I find that the amount of batter per cup is not much, so the muffins are a bit small. Next time, I’ll reduce the cooking temp. to 400F.
I made these in the morning. Super simple ingredients. I added apples sauce instead of oil, and some fresh strawberries to the mix. They were great. Not too sweet and the kids loved them.

I made mine gluten free and dairy free I double the recipe added vanilla and cinnamon and nutmeg to it my five and seven year old picky eater absolutely loves it I used Pillsbury gluten-free flour and almond milk is amazing.
Used peanut butter 3 cups 1 cup of Nutella , made 3 times the portions! Add butter perfect for breakfast
This was so easy, a bird brain can do it. Simple ingredients, nice light fluffy muffins. RIP ASHLI Babbitt

I added a little brown sugar, a splash of vanilla extract, and some mini semisweet chocolate chips. My teen boy loved them. I only baked for 17 minutes. Next time I'll use a lower baking temp. Also next time I would use more oats and less flour.
Good recipe. I added freeze dried fruit! I also added cinnamon and apple pie spice and a bit of cardamon!

I added a little more sugar, a tiny bit of vanilla extract, and included some Craisins. Liked, not loved. But just as others have indicated, it is a good base recipe allowing for many different adjustments according to personal taste. I will keep it for that reason alone.
I added a drizzle of honey on top out of the oven. Perfect yummy muffin low cal too.

Good base recipe. It’s not very sweet with just 1/4 cup of sugar. I might bump it to 1/3 next time or add maple syrup. I also added about 1/3 tsp of vanilla extract and several shakes of cinnamon to the base batter. I added chopped apples, blueberries, raisins and craisins, each fruit was added separately to the already filled muffin batter as it was in the tin before baking. I finished them all off with more cinnamon and slivered almonds. I did 20 min at 425 and think I might do 23 minutes next time. Overall I am very happy and will continue to experiment with the recipe!
Easy
Super easy and delicious! No muffin wrappers? Use parchment paper cut up into squares and place inside muffin tins.

I will use this as a base recipe again. I found that although using the amount of baking powder listed gave the muffins a nice loft, it also gave them a real unpleasant bite. I will reduce the baking powder.
I’ve made these a few times. Good as is, good with chopped apples and banana in the mix, but if sugar sprinkled on top.

Just as the recipe title states "easy". I like a muffin that doesn't taste like you're eating pure sugar. This pairs well with your favorite jam or jelly. I did add vanilla, and maple syrup, raisons as some of the other reviewers suggested. I will make these again. Thank you!

I made them exactly as the recipe states the first time, since then I've been doubling it, using brown sugar, and adding whatever comes to mind. They are very versatile, and if you over fill the tin a bit, the muffins are "breakfast sized" perfectly for my husband.

These are horribly bland. I even added things to try to help and it didn't. I have no idea what is going on in this recipe that makes them so unenjoyable, so please don't waste your time on this recipe. Or eat them steaming hit directly out of the tins as that's the only way they are palatable.
Easy and quick to make and bake. Pretty bland right out of the oven but wait a day and the flavor develops and they are then delicious! They keep really well right on the counter. So, plan ahead.
I addeed ground flax, cinammon and choc chips. Better!

Tasty but barely enough to make 11 muffins and the cook time was far less than the recipe said. We have a brand new range and they took 15 mins to cook fully. Would double batter next time and add vanilla and cinnamon ??
Quick and easy , I added White Chocolate Chips to it instead of plain oatmeal muffins and*or Oatmeal raisin, turned out amazing
Great recipe, added blueberries
Love this recipe for the simplicity and lower sugar. Keep in mind these are muffins, not cupcakes!! No frosting, chocolate chips, sprinkles, extra needed.

The muffins I added half cup chocolate chips 1 tsp cinnamon 1 tsp vanilla a 1/3 cup more flour. They are 
Pretty good altho pretty small. So next time triple recipie to make a dozen

I really like this muffin recipes they really are quick and easy, and adaptable. I substituted applesauce for oil, and whole wheat flour for the all purpose flour, then added chocolate chips and pecan pieces and they were wonderful.
I added 1 tsp of vanilla, a couple healthy shakes of cinnamon, and 1/2 cup golden raisins. I prefer this style of muffin as it is not sweet like cake, this is the way muffins are intended to be.

I've made these muffins around 12 times. If you're looking for a "super sweet might as well be a cupcake muffin" look elsewhere because these aren't those. I always replace a third of the flour with whole wheat flour. Blueberries or chocolate chips mix in well. I've also replaced some of the sugar with maple syrup and added 1 tsp of maple extract for fun. They really only need 1/2 the baking time recommended. I like to double the recipe and freeze a big batch to thaw for an easy breakfast or snack.

Easy and Excellent results! 
I used 1/2 cup of brown sugar instead of white and added 1 540 ml can (drained) of pineapple tidbits. 
Looking forward to trying apple and cinnamon, another favorite flavor!
I like them they remind me of jiffy cornbread but I think I forgot the salt in mine lol
These are delicious! I added a handful of mini chocolate chips otherwise stuck to the recipe
Excellent! I substituted the white sugar for brown sugar, but they turned out perfect and I loved that they weren't over-sweet

I think substituting brown sugar for white sugar would've made a huge difference. I doubled it, added 1 tablespoon vanilla, 1 tsp cinnamon and substituted 2 packets of instant snickerdoodle oatmeal for 3/4 of a cup of oatmeal and added an additional cup of oatmeal to make it a full cup. I think next time I'll add more cinnamon and vanilla and a bit more sugar.
This is a very tasty muffin. I added grated apple and chopped peanuts. I thought the texture was perfect! I will definitely make these again.

I used coconut oil instead of vegetable oil and brown sugar instead of white. I added 1/2 c reduced sugar craisins, 1/2 c chopped pecans and 1/2 tsp of cinnamon. The recipe is basic and lends itself to whatever flavor or texture you want to add. A flexible recipe is great as I can add whatever I have on hand. Fast, easy and a nice change from the usual breakfast.

These were pretty good. I made a few changes/additions. I used white wheat flour b/c we eat healthy. I had some buttermilk to use up so I did, added vanilla, cinnamon, chocolate chips, pecans. I never made these just following the recipe, but this is definitely a keeper.

These were delicious! I made them for my toddler and he gobbled them up! I added a little more sugar (probably like 1/3 cup rather than 1/4 cup). Also used almond milk, white wheat flour, and 1/4 melted butter as that's what I had on hand, and also added cinnamon and nutmeg. I'll definitely make these again!
Added cinnamon and raisins without which these might have been very bland. Okay but quite dry.

These are the most wonderful muffins I've ever made. 

I only added raisins. The rest the same. Amazing.
A very good basic muffin recipe. I’m looking forward to trying some variations with fruit, nuts and spices! I made this dairy free by substituting water and a tsp of vegan margarine for the milk.
I just wiped it together, used water instead of milk and backed in my air fryer for 10 min and wow they are great!!! I also, added raisins to give it a little more pizzazz:)

I've been wanting something sweet, but not like a cupcake or cookie. What better than a muffin recipe? I'm very picky when it comes to my muffins. I like a hardy and semi-healthy breakfast item that gives me energy to go in the morning. I already thoroughly enjoy oatmeal cookies, so I thought that this would be a good alternative. I looked at the comments and followed other people's changes in the recipes. Instead of oil i used applesauce, and instead of white sugar, I used brown sugar; 2/3 to be exact. I've got a but of a sweet tooth, and i saw that this recipe could be a little bland if you don't add any fruits or other flavorings. Along with those changes, I added a couple dashes of cinnamon, a generous pinch of nutmeg, and I wanted to add vanilla, but I forgot at the end. It's a small batch; I had just enough for 6 large muffins. It's such an easy recipe that I could whip it up again any time. I added raisins to 2 of them, finely chopped apples mixed with brown sugar to the next 2, and left the last 2 plain. I'd cook it for less than I did because they were a little tough, but that could also be because I over mixed it. Be very careful with that. After they were done, I dusted powdered sugar over them for a pretty finishing touch. The apple muffins were fantastic, and so were the raisin. The plain ones were no match to the others. The recipe is not bad if you touch it up yourself and add a little bit of your magic to it. Would recommend.
I added raisins, walnuts, and 1/3 cup of light brown sugar to make them sweeter.
I used the flavored instant oatmeal packets. 4 is right about perfect. And almond milk, I gotta get that nasty stuff out of my fridge lol. I am going to turn the heat down on my next batch

This recipe was so easy. I used brown sugar instead of white and used applesauce instead of oil. Also added apples, orange peel, almond extract, cinnamon, and chia seed. It had just the right amount of sweetness for me and is perfect with a cup of coffee.

I searched many oatmeal muffins but they had so many extra ingredients I don’t keep on hand. I had all the ingredients for this simple but delicious recipe. Not overly sweet and simple enough to share with my 13 month old!
this recipe is just great, and i'm not sure if there's anymore to it. it's simply wonderful
These turned out very bland and extremely dense.
used 1/4 cup whole wheat flour, brown sugar, coconut oil, and 1/2 tsp Cinnamon, dash nutmeg
I had 2 packets of instant apple cinnamon oatmeal so I included this in the cup of oatmeal. Sprinkled cinnamon, brown sugar and pecans on top. Will make again.

Great basic recipe, but I think it would be boring without adding something. I added Craisins, pecans, cinnamon, & nutmeg. I also think berries, apples, or bananas would be good. I also used 1/3 cup sugar instead of 1/4, & they were just the right sweetness.
I made these exactly as thevrecioe called for and they are delicious . There were easy to do and great fir breakfast.
So delicious, However, if you want it to be a little less plain add some yummy cinnamon and/or nutmeg. So So good. I love these so much!!!

I made these yesterday morning for breakfast my mom really loved them. I added some walnuts, vanilla flavor and nutmeg also instead of regular sugar I used 2 cups of Splenda sugar . They were delicious.
Perfect. This was the perfect base recipe for muffins. I added banana and used regular oats and it worked great. It wasn't too sweet or too bland. Thanks for the recipe!
I made it with blueberries (1 cup) that I rolled in the flour mix. I subbed in stevia for sugar. Delicious.

I made them Gluten Free for my child with Celiac. I used 1/8 cup of coconut oil instead of 1/4 veg oil, 2 eggs instead of one, rolled oats not quick oats, 1/2 tsp of Cinnamon and 1/8 cup of honey instead of sugar and Pamelas all purpose GF flour blend (blue bag). Good solid muffin my son likes to eat with homemade black jam because "if you give a moose a muffin..."

Made these with my 10 year old daughter. We were lazy and threw all the ingredients into one bowl, giving it a little stir. We didn't let the oats soak either. We also added cinnamon, vanilla extract, and chocolate chips. Loved them. The texture was perfect, despite not following the recipe exactly. We will make these again.
I made it but it was a little tuff an the bottom ended up burning but the inside was really nice I added cinnamon so next time I’m going to add more milk an oil an won’t put the stove so high

Excellent! Worth ten stars if you make additions and a couple substitutions. I now make these all the time. I use whole wheat flour and rolled oats but otherwise make the batter as written (except that I use 1/4 cup honey or maple syrup, so they are probably a tad sweeter). 

The muffins themselves have a very mild flavor. I always end up adding something just for fun. I love cocoa powder and frozen mixed berries, or banana chunks and mini chocolate chips. For a great twist, try frozen cranberries and mandarin oranges (with orange juice instead of milk). I always add chopped nuts and sometimes cinnamon and/or an extract.

I baked at 350F. I mixed all the dry ingredients together, added a mix of the wet ones, and baked without letting it sit.I added 1/4 cup brown sugar, 1 teaspoon cinnamon, 1/4 tsp cloves, 1/4 tsp allspice and 1/2 tsp vanilla. It worked out great!

Added mini chocolate chips, substituted coconut oil, brown sugar (and used less), whole wheat flour, added vanilla and cinnamon per others recommendation and its a nice, simple and relatively healthy muffin recipe that our whole family appreciates. Good for breakfast or afternoon snacks.
My picky kids loved it. Easy recipe to follow. I chose to add 1tsp of vanilla extract and 1/2 tsp of cinnamon for flavor.

Easy oatmeal muffin, as promised! These are wonderful when made using this recipe. I made no change to the ingredients-- only thing I did differently was after taking them out of the muffin tins, I smeared on just a little butter, them put them super close to my countertop oven on the BROIL setting. Watch carefully, and just give these little beauties some crispy brown on the top. I have some homemade jam and these were perfect. Toasty, hint of crispness from the browning, and allowed my jam to shine. (Whoa! I forgot! -- I used melted butter and not vegetable/canola oil -- that stuff is just horrid -- use butter or maybe light olive oil, or melted coconut oil)

Such an easy and resilient baking recipe! I've made tons of substitutions and it turns out great anyway, and from the comments on the page, other people had the same experience. I added a cup of grated carrots, a tablespoon of grated fresh ginger, a teaspoon of cinnamon, and a 1/4 cup of raisins. Also bumped up the sugar a tad and replaced the vegetable oil with butter, and it turned out great even with all of those changes!

I feel badly to rate this so low. I followed the recipe exactly as listed. I checked them several minutes before the time was up. They were done, so I took them out to cool and poured them onto a cooling rack. They unfortunately were dry and also a bit hard. My oven is accurate, so I am wondering if the cooking time needed to be even less.
Very easy to follow. I added cinnamon and streusel on top

Love love love the simple oatmeal muffin recipe nutritious and delicious next time I will add walnuts and maybe bananas and I will double it..... my one and a half-year-old granddaughter love them too and so did my family !! love them simple nutritious breakfast I can grab and go! Perfect easy recipe

Love this as a base for other muffins, but only needed 20 minutes at 400 degrees. And, I did one and a half times the recipe requirements to make bigger muffins!
Substitute canned coconut milk, substitute brown sugar, and used coconut oil instead of vegetable oil. 
Then I do one of two things:
Add 2 tsp vanilla, 1c fresh blue berries. Yum!
Or...
2 tsp cinnamon, 2 ripe bananas mashed up, 1/2c crushed walnuts, 1/2c chocolate chips. 
For the second I needed to add a splash of milk to thin out the batter a little.
Finding myself making some variation of these every week!
Great start to bring me to my recipe! I doubled everything except the baking soda. I did 1/2 cup brown sugar and 1/2 cup white sugar. I added 2 teaspoons of vanilla and 1 teaspoon of cinnamon
I made these and added dried cranberries and chopped walnuts. They are so delicious and the perfect addition to breakfast or afternoon snack!
The texture is nice...but even after I added drained, crushed pineapple to the batter, the muffins were fairly bland. Won't make again.

I love this recipe. It's so easy and you can switch it up and it always results in delicious muffins. I have used stevia Instead of sugar, added 2 bananas and a cup of blueberries. A muffin only had 140 cal which is a great healthy snack. Thank you for the great recipe.
I used olive oil, brown sugar, whole fat milk, then added bits of dried fruit. THE MUFFINS ARE AMAZING! Super pleased!
These were prefect! Exactly like I'd hoped they would be! Thank you! !

They are so delicious!! I Love them. I followed recipe exactly.
I will make them again.
I make these all the time and have experimented with the recipe too. They are easy to make and taste great. Sometimes I’ll add a banana too, add cinnamon, etc.
Easy to make and is moist and delicious. I added blueberries, otherwise followed the directions as is.

I did not make any changes except for baking them 15-17 minutes. By that time, they were already browned on top. If I had let them bake longer, they would have burned. I really enjoyed this recipe "as is." I didn't add anything to, or take anything from, the original recipe. I read others' reviews mentioning that they weren't as sweet as expected, but I don't like muffins that taste incredibly sweet or almost like a cupcake. If I make these again, I would probably add some boiled raisins, cinnamon, and a bit of vanilla extract. This recipe was super simple, and the resulting muffins were gone quickly.

I made a lot of substitutions, sorry! But the proportions are all the same. These were my attempt to get my picky eaters to try something new that is a little healthy.
So I:
Subbed coconut milk for the cow milk.
Subbed half coconut oil, half unsweetened apple sauce for the veg oil.
Subbed approx 2 tbs of cocoa powder for some of the flour.
Mixed about a tsp of molasses into the sugar, and used maybe a tsp less sugar overall.
Added approx 1/2 tsp vanilla.

These I baked in a mini muffin tin for about 10 minutes. My kids both loved the result: a mildly sweet, mildly chocolate muffin. Will definitely make again. Thanks!
I just followed the ingredients & recipes. It tastes good. Not to sweet. Btw, i just used brown sugar instead of white sugar and used grapeseed oil instead of vegetable oil.

Super easy with few steps, though it does makes a lot of dirty dishes. I added cinnamon to one batch and blueberries to another. I meant to add cinnamon sugar on top for both batches but forgot. Both were fantastic. These are a perfect muffin! I can't wait to have these with hard boiled eggs for this week's breakfast. I can't wait to try a peanut butter, banana, chocolate chip version. I never get a dozen though, only 8 small ones, which is fine since it's just me.
I love these simple muffins. I did add about a teaspoon or two of vanilla extract. Next time I'll try different variations. My favorite thing about these is they're not too sweet.
Super easy! I had old fashioned oats so soaked them a little longer and added 1 tsp cinnamon. Perfect!

We LOVE these muffins. Rather than buy junk food snacks at the store, I've started making these to have for afternoon snacks. They're cheaper and healthier than any of those other pre-made snacks at the store (fruit snacks, fruit & grain bars, etc) I love how versatile this recipe is. If the plain muffins are a little too bland for you, you could try adding a tiny bit of butter and little sprinkles of sugar in the raw (or just white sugar) to the tops of them, and it will totally change the flavor.

I've made these muffins three different times:

1) First time it was made exactly like the recipe for the first batch (ie. plain). The second batch I replaced white sugar for brown, added some cinnamon, and added a powder sugar, water, and vanilla gaze to the top (after they baked). Both batches were moist.

2) The second time I made a batch of plain and a batch of blueberry. I added vanilla, and to the the blueberry muffins, before putting them into the oven, I sprayed a little spray butter and sprinkled a little sugar in the raw on the top of them. For some reason they were a little dry though.

3) The third time (just now) I made blueberry again, the same way as I did the second time. However, since they were so dry the second time I decided to add just a little more milk to the oatmeal (maybe 1 tablespoon). That may have been just a wee bit too much milk, but they sure are moist and DELICIOUS.

This recipe is good. But it needs to be doubled to get muffins that are a decent size. The first time I made this, the muffins were really small. Also, I ended up adding vanilla extract to give them a bit more flavor. Almond extract works well. Or adding in a teaspoon of cinnamon is also another way to add some flavor. If you want a less coarse muffin texture, heating up the milk before adding it to the oats helps. The oats seem to soak up the milk better. Then let it sit for the 15 minutes as directed.

I have made this several times and it is agreat base recipe that handles substitutions well! Made as is - it's a great base muffin to add jam with. 

I do several variations - banana chocolate ship, fresh fruit, peanut butter etc.
I used buttermilk, added raisins, and regular (not quick) oats. They came out of the oven with a little crunch and very nice flavor.
I love this recipe! I have a sweet tooth so I add a crumb topping of brown sugar oatmeal and butter.
I used fruit juice in place of milk and also added fine coconut to this recipe...the result was a hit with the family...one said it taste like the coconut oatmeal cookies that I make.

This is a lovely muffin! I was a little worried by comments about a bland muffin, but it's really a nice basic, muffin. I followed the recipe as written (processing old fashioned oats to make quick oats); the muffins turned out light and lovely. Although this is a basic muffin, the oats give it a rich flavor, and there is a bit of sweetness to it. It tastes good as is, but lends itself to additions other reviewers have mentioned adding. I made these to trial wheat as a new food for our toddler, and he will certainly prefer these to the dry, oat-only muffins he's had until now :) I will definitely be making these again for my family.

Terrible , no flavour, made as is...yuk.
Next time I would definitely make adjustments.
I love to eat oats just plain and this made them even better! Cinnamon and vanilla is a great addition too. I loved these muffins!
They baked well.. But sorry to say they had no flavor...

These are an simple, plain, but rich tasting muffin. They are great with jam, which normally accompanies muffins (along with grated cheese).
I added 1/2 tsp. vanilla, but could have gone to 1 tsp. I also substituted melted butter for the oil. I try to avoid refined oils, plus butter gave them a richer flavor. Those who commented on their bland taste, may want to try using butter.

We make these all the time but like most people I change it up. I double the recipe and make them large or mini. I like to use almond milk. I use half almond flour half white. I use brown sugar instead of white. Coconut oil instead of vegetable. I also add cinnamon and vanilla. My husband loves them. We don't like overly sweet so these are perfect.
